com.epoch.xmlparser

Class XMLUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.epoch.xmlparser.XMLUtils
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AuthorConstants, TopicQSetConstants, XMLConstants

    public final class XMLUtils
extends Object
implements TopicQSetConstants, XMLConstants
    Holds XML utility functions.

      • zipXML

        public static String zipXML(String filename,
                            List<String> xmlAndImageNames)
        Export XML of topics or question sets or questions to a zip file.
        Parameters:
        filename - name of the file in which the exported questions will be stored
        xmlAndImageNames - array whose first member is the XML, and remaining members are filenames of images
        Returns:
        the name of the zip file

      • extractNodes

        public static NodeList extractNodes(String zipFilename)
                             throws FileFormatException
        Extract node list from an XML file, saving images to disk.
        Parameters:
        zipFilename - name and location of zip file containing the questions
        Returns:
        a NodeList
        Throws:
        FileFormatException - if the XML cannot be parsed

        Parameters:
        xmlStr - String containing the XML to be parsed
        Returns:
        the string converted to a Node

        Parameters:
        zipFilename - name and location of zip file containing the questions
        Returns:
        the XML file
        Throws:
        FileFormatException - if the file isn't zipped

        Parameters:

        attributes - array of 2-member arrays of attributes and their values
        newLine - whether to add a new line
        selfClosing - whether the tag is self-closing
        Returns:
        the tag and its attributes wrapped in < > or < />; attribute values are formatted appropriately

      • makeNode

        public static StringBuilder makeNode(String tag,
                                     String text)
        Surround the given text with the given XML tags. Do NOT call this method for molecules; instead, use makeNode(tag, text, needsNewLine) and set needsNewLine to !NEWLINE.
        Parameters:
        tag - the name of the XML tag
        text - the text of the node
        Returns:
        the text surrounded by XML tags

      • makeNode

        public static StringBuilder makeNode(String tag,
                                     String text,
                                     boolean needsNewLine)
        Surround the given text with the given XML tags. Call this method for molecules with needsNewLine set to !NEWLINE, and do not trim the values obtained after parsing the XML; MOL format requires an opening return character, and MRV requires no opening return character.
        Parameters:
        tag - the name of the XML tag
        text - the text of the node
        needsNewLine - whether to put a return character after the opening tag and the data; always make false for molecules
        Returns:
        the text surrounded by XML tags
